name: barge tanker production | barge tanker | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4050/documentation

The dataset represents the manufacturing and disposal of one barge tanker with an average total capacity of 1200 t/vessel.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

Barge tanker production starting with material consumption.

The activity ends with the production of one barge tanker. The dataset includes material consumption, energy consumption, disposal for non metal components and use of paint and emissions of the solvent of paint as NMVOC. The dataset doesn't include the consumption of lubricates.
category: C:Manufacturing/30:Manufacture of other transport equipment/301:Building of ships and boats/3011:Building of ships and floating structures

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Manufacturing data represents conditions in Europe.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The data is derived from an assessment of one barge, with a load capacity of 2800t Bialonski (1990; Engelkamp (1993) as quoted in Maibach et al. (1999). This data was adjusted to model a barge tanker, representing the current average total capacity for  a barge tanker (1200 t/vessel). For manufacturing, electricity and heavy oil burned in industrial furnace are included. Energy consumption in manufacturing was estimated as 50% of the cumulative energy of the used materials. The split of energies is 10% electricity and 90% heavy fuel oil Frischknecht et al. (1996). In this project waste treatment processes for non metal components of vessels are accounted for. For inland waterways vessels we assume that they are painted 10 times in their entire life span.;References:;Bialonski W. (1990) Spezifischer Energieeinsatz im Verkehr – Ermittlung und Vergleich der spezifischen Energieverbräuche. Forschungsbericht FE Nr. 90 247/88, im Auftrag des Bundesministers für Verkehr (ausgeführt am Verkehrswissenschaftlichen Institut der Rheinisch-Westfälischen Technischen Hochschule Aachen), Bonn;Engelkamp P. (1993) Stellungnahme des Europäischen Entwicklungszent-rums für die Binnenschifffahrt e.V. Duisburg zum Fragenkatalog für die öffentliche Anhörung der Enquete Komission " Schutz des Menschen und der Umwelt". Enquete Komission zum Thema "Mobilität - Darstellung, Bewertung und Optimierung von Stoffströmen., Bonn;Maibach M., Peter D. and Seiler B. (1999) Ökoinventar Transporte: Grundlagen für den ökologischen Vergleich von Transportsystemen und den Einbezug von Transportsystemen in Ökobilanzen. Technischer Schlussbericht. In: Schweizerischer Nationalfonds zur Förderung der wissenschaftlichen Forschung (ed. SPP Umwelt M.). 2nd Edition. INFRAS, Zürich;Frischknecht R., Bollens U., Bosshart S., Ciot M., Ciseri L., Doka G., Dones R., Gantner U. and Hischier R. (1996) Ökoinventare von Energie-systemen: Grundlagen für den ökologischen Vergleich von Energiesyste-men und den Einbezug von Energiesystemen in Ökobilanzen für die Schweiz. Auflage No. 3. Gruppe Energie - Stoffe - Umwelt (ESU), Eid-genössische Technische Hochschule Zuerich und Sektion Ganzheitliche Systemanalysen, Paul Scherrer Institut, Villigen, Bundesamt für Energie (Hrsg.), Bern

exchanges.description: Estimation. For inland waterways vessels it's assumed that they are painted 10 times in their entire life span. NMVOC emissions are estimated based on a 60% solvent content in the used paint and assuming that the entire amount of solvents is released as NMVOC.

exchanges.description:
Estimation. Energy consumption in manufacturing was estimated as 50% of the cumulative energy of the used materials. The split of energies is 10% electricity and 90% heavy fuel oil Frischknecht et al. (1996).

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=CH
Literature value.The exchanges of the barge tanker manufacturing are derived from an assessment of one barge, with a load capacity of 2800t Bialonski (1990; Engelkamp (1993) as quoted in Maibach et al. (1999). This data was adjusted to model a barge tanker, representing the current average total capacity for  a barge tanker (1200 t/vessel).
